t: 1 Kings 18
Elijah’s Message to Ahab
And*p it came to pass after*i many days that the word of the Lord*s came to Elijah, in the third year, saying, “Go, present yourself to Ahab, and I will send rain on the earth.”
So*p Elijah went to present himself to Ahab; and there*i was*i a severe famine in Samaria.
And Ahab had called Obadiah, who was*i in charge of his*i house. (Now Obadiah feared the Lord*s greatly.
For so it was, while Jezebel massacred the prophets of the Lord,*s that Obadiah had taken one hundred prophets and hidden them, fifty to a cave, and had fed them with bread and water.)

And Ahab had said to Obadiah, “Go into the land to all the springs of water and to all the brooks; perhaps we may find grass to keep the horses and mules alive, so that we will not have to kill any livestock.”
So they divided the land between them to explore it; Ahab went one way by himself, and Obadiah went another way by himself.
Now*p as Obadiah was on his way, suddenly Elijah met him; and he recognized him, and fell on his face, and said, “Is*i that you, my lord Elijah?”
And*p he answered him, “It*i is*i I. Go, tell your master, ‘Elijah is*i here.’”*i
So*p he said, “How have I sinned, that you are delivering your servant into the hand of Ahab, to kill me?

As*i the Lord*s your God lives, there is no nation or kingdom where my master has not sent someone to hunt for you; and when they said, ‘He*i is*i not here,’*i he took an oath from the kingdom or nation that they could not find you.
And now you say, ‘Go, tell your master, “Elijah is*i here”’!*i

And it shall come to pass, as*i soon*i as*i I am gone from you, that the Spirit of the Lord*s will carry you to a place I do not know; so when I go and tell Ahab, and he cannot find you, he will kill me. But I your servant have feared the Lord*s from my youth.
Was it not reported to my lord what I did when Jezebel killed the prophets of the Lord,*s how I hid one hundred men of the Lord’s*s prophets, fifty to a cave, and fed them with bread and water?
And now you say, ‘Go, tell your master, “Elijah is*i here.”’*i He will kill me!”
Then*p Elijah said, “As*i the Lord*s of hosts lives, before whom I stand, I will surely present myself to him today.”
So*p Obadiah went to meet Ahab, and told him; and Ahab went to meet Elijah.
Then*p it happened, when Ahab saw Elijah, that Ahab said to him, “Is*i that*i you, O troubler of Israel?”
And*p he answered, “I have not troubled Israel, but you and your father’s house have,*i in that you have forsaken the commandments of the Lord*s and have followed the Baals.
Now therefore, send and*i gather all Israel to me on Mount Carmel, the four hundred and fifty prophets of Baal, and the four hundred prophets of Asherah, who eat at Jezebel’s table.”
Elijah’s Mount Carmel Victory
So*p Ahab sent for all the children of Israel, and gathered the prophets together on Mount Carmel.
And Elijah came to all the people, and said, “How long will you falter between two opinions? If the Lord*s is*i God, follow Him; but if Baal, follow him.” But the people answered him not a word.
Then Elijah said to the people, “I alone am left a prophet of the Lord;*s but Baal’s prophets are*i four hundred and fifty men.

Therefore let them give us two bulls; and let them choose one bull for themselves, cut it in pieces, and lay it*i on the wood, but put no fire under*i it;*i and I will prepare the other bull, and lay it*i on the wood, but put no fire under*i it.*i
Then you call on the name of your gods, and I will call on the name of the Lord;*s and the God who answers by fire, He is God.” So*p all the people answered and said, “It is well spoken.”
Now*p Elijah said to the prophets of Baal, “Choose one bull for yourselves and prepare it*i first, for you are*i many; and call on the name of your god, but put no fire under*i it.”*i

So*p they took the bull which was given them, and they prepared it,*i and called on the name of Baal from morning even till noon, saying, “O Baal, hear us!” But there*i was*i no voice; no one answered. Then they leaped about the altar which they had made.

And*p so it was, at noon, that Elijah mocked them and said, “Cry aloud, for he is*i a god; either he is meditating, or he is busy, or he is on a journey, or*i perhaps he is sleeping and must be awakened.”
So they cried aloud, and cut themselves, as was their custom, with knives and lances, until the blood gushed out on them.
And when midday was past, they prophesied until the time*i of the offering of the evening*i sacrifice. But there*i was*i no voice; no one answered, no one paid attention.
Then*p Elijah said to all the people, “Come near to me.” So all the people came near to him. And he repaired the altar of the Lord*s that*i was*i broken down.
And Elijah took twelve stones, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Jacob, to whom the word of the Lord*s had come, saying, “Israel shall be your name.”
Then with the stones he built an altar in the name of the Lord;*s and he made a trench around the altar large enough to hold two seahs of seed.
And he put the wood in order, cut the bull in pieces, and laid it*i on the wood, and said, “Fill four waterpots with water, and pour it*i on the burnt sacrifice and on the wood.”
Then he said, “Do it*i a second time,” and they did it*i a second time; and he said, “Do it*i a third time,” and they did it*i a third time.
So the water ran all around the altar; and he also filled the trench with water.

And*p it came to pass, at the*i time*i of*i the offering of the evening*i sacrifice, that Elijah the prophet came near and said, “Lord*s God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, let it be known this day that You are*i God in Israel and I am*i Your servant, and that*i I have done all these things at Your word.
Hear me, O Lord,*s hear me, that this people may know that You are*i the Lord*s God, and that*i You have turned their hearts back to*i You*i again.”
Then*p the fire of the Lord*s fell and consumed the burnt sacrifice, and the wood and the stones and the dust, and it licked up the water that was*i in the trench.
Now when all the people saw it,*i they fell on their faces; and they said, “The Lord,*s He is*i God! The Lord,*s He is*i God!”
And*p Elijah said to them, “Seize the prophets of Baal! Do not let one of them escape!” So they seized them; and Elijah brought them down to the Brook Kishon and executed them there.
The Drought Ends
Then*p Elijah said to Ahab, “Go up, eat and drink; for there*i is*i the sound of abundance of rain.”
So Ahab went up to eat and drink. And Elijah went up to the top of Carmel; then he bowed down on the ground, and put his face between his knees,
and said to his servant, “Go up now, look toward the sea.” So*p he went up and looked, and said, “There*i is*i nothing.” And seven times he said, “Go again.”

Then*p it came to pass the seventh time,*i that he said, “There is a cloud, as small as a man’s hand, rising out of the sea!” So he said, “Go up, say to Ahab, ‘Prepare your*i chariot,*i and go down before the rain stops you.’”
Now*p it happened in the meantime that the sky became black with clouds and wind, and there was a heavy rain. So Ahab rode away and went to Jezreel.
Then the hand of the Lord*s came upon Elijah; and he girded up his loins and ran ahead of Ahab to the entrance of Jezreel.
